characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model with an artificer armour gains a 2+ Save.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model with an iron halo gains a 4+ Invulnerable Save.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model with a storm shield gains a 3+ Invulnerable Save, Invulnerable Saves granted by a storm shield do not stack with other Invulnerable Saves, and cannot be modified by any other special rule. If a model has another Invulnerable Save then the controlling player must choose one to use. A model with a storm shield may never gain an additional Attack for being armed with two close combat weapons or make attacks using a weapon with the Twohanded special rule.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model with a boarding shield gains a 6+ Invulnerable Save. But a model with a boarding shield cannot claim bonus attacks for having more than one melee weapon, or make attacks during the Assault phase using a weapon with the Two-handed special rule.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model with a combat shield gains a 6+ Invulnerable Save.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text:
At the start of the controlling player’s Movement phase, or when deployed as part of a Deep Strike Assault, a model with a Legion Warhawk jump pack may set its Move Characteristic to a value of 12 for the duration of the controlling player’s turn (sometimes referred to as ‘activating’ the jump pack). This allows a model with a Warhawk jump pack to move up to 12", regardless of the Movement Characteristic shown on its profile and gain any other benefits of a Movement Characteristic of 12 (including the bonus to Charge distance). In addition, all models with a Warhawk jump pack that have been activated ignore terrain while Moving and Charging, but must take Dangerous Terrain tests as normal when beginning or ending their Movement in Dangerous Terrain. A model with an activated Legion Warhawk jump pack treats all Difficult Terrain as Dangerous Terrain and may move over both friendly and enemy models or units without penalty – but must end its Movement at least 1" away from any model from another unit.

A model with a Legion Warhawk jump pack may still Run if it would normally be able to Run (this does not allow units that include any models with the Heavy Sub-type to Run). When making a Run move for a model with an activated Legion Warhawk jump pack, add the Initiative Characteristic of that model to 12 to determine how far it may move – the model ignores terrain and models from other units while making a Run move with a Legion Warhawk jump pack as previously noted, but may not make Shooting Attacks or declare a Charge in the same turn in which it has Run as per the normal rules for Running.

Any model with a Legion Warhawk jump pack also gains the Bulky (2), Hammer of Wrath (1) and Deep Strike special rules – if it already has the Bulky (2) special rule, it gains the Bulky (3) special rule instead.

During a Reaction made in any Phase, a player may not choose to activate a model’s Legion Warhawk jump pack to gain any bonus to its Movement Characteristic. Any models with a Legion Warhawk jump pack deployed as part of a Deep Strike Assault are considered to have activated their jump packs in the turn that they enter play.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: An Astartes combat bike has one twin-linked bolter. In addition, a model with a Astartes combat bike that chooses to Run gains the Shrouded (X+) special rule until the start of the controlling player's next turn. A model with the Infantry Unit Type tha selects an Astartes combat bike as an upgrade must change its Unit Type to Cavalry, keeping any Unit Sub-types it previously had, and may choose to gain the Skirmish Unit Sub-type. ln addition the model must change its Movement Characteristic to 14, Toughness 5 and gains the Firing Protocols (2) and Hammer of Wrath (1) special rules.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: Any enemy model within 18" and line of sight of a model with a psychic hood must reduce its Leadership by -2 when making Psychic checks. This modifier is not cumulative and no model may suffer from penalties from more than one psychic hood.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model with a cognis-signum gains the Night Vision special rule. In addition, in lieu of the model with the cognis-signum making a Shooting Attack in the Shooting phase, all other models in the same unit gain a bonus of +1 to their BS for that Shooting phase. This benefit is not cumulative, and no unit can benefit from more than one bonus to their BS from cognis-signum.

rules.name: Vox Disruptor Array
rules.description: At the start of each Game Turn you can declare whether each vox disruptor array in your army is turned on or turned off. While there is at least one model on the battlefield with a vox disruptor array turned on, regardless of whether that model is enemy or friendly, any attempt to perform a Deep Strike Assault, Drop Pod Assault, Area Denial Drop or Subterranean Assault during that turn is Disordered on the roll of a ‘1’, ‘2’ or ‘3’ instead of just on a ‘1’.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: While at least one model with a nuncio-vox is present on the battlefield and not Embarked in a Vehicle or Building, the controlling player may re-roll any Scatter rolls made (whether as part of a weapon attack or the deployment of a model or unit), as long as the model with the nuncio-vox has line of sight to the unit targeted by the attack or the point chosen as the target of the deployment. In addition, a unit that includes at least one model with a nuncio-vox ignores the -1 penalty to Leadership imposed by the Night Fighting rules.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: All models with the Infantry or Cavalry Unit Types in a unit that includes at least one model with a narthecium gain the Feel No Pain (5+) special rule. Units that include more than one narthecium do not stack the Feel No Pain (X) special rule and gain no additional benefit. Models with the Artillery Sub-type are not affected by this special rule and do not gain the Feel No Pain (X) special rule.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model with a cyber-familiar adds +1 to its Invulnerable Save (to a maximum of 3+) or an Invulnerable Save of 6+ if they do not already possess one. In addition, they allow them to re-roll failed Characteristic tests other than Leadership tests, Psychic checks or failed Dangerous Terrain tests.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The Warlord and any unit he joins gains the Shrouded (6+) Special Rule, this may stack with any other version of the shrouded rule eg. Shrouded (5+) from Evade goes to Shrouded (4+) etc. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Shooting Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The warlord and up to 3 units may be given the Outflank special rule. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Movement Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: During any Assault phase in which Thulsa Kane is fighting a challenge, all friendly units with Chapter Tactics (Executioners) gain a +1 bonus to their score for working out the victor in an assault and +1 to any Sweeping Advance Rolls. While Thulsa Kane is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the movement phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The warlord and all friendly units within 6", add +1 to their results when rolling for charge distance. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Assault Phase.

characteristics.name: Special Rules
characteristics.$text: Barrage, Large Blast (5”), Lance, One Shot, Orbital Strike

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text:
Before a battle Naravaez’ s controlling player may elect to use one of the following 3 options for the coming battle. This must be declared after table sides have been picked, but before any units are deployed.

Direct Fire Support
In lieu of firing a weapon, Naravaez may call down an Orbital Bombardment once per game. This may be fired even if he moved and may be fired at a different unit than what his unit has shot at and will not stop his unit from charging in the following Assault Phase. It may not be fired as part of a Reaction. In addition the controlling player may make an additional Reaction in the Shooting Phase.

Heavy Drop-craft
If chosen the Controlling Player may elect to give up to 3 Vehicles with 4 hull points or less the Deep Strike Special rule. In addition, the Controlling player may make an additional Reaction in the Movement Phase.

Pinpoint Augur Sweeps
If chosen the controlling player may elect to give up to 3 units, the Night Vision and Scout Special rules. In addition, the controlling player may make an additional reaction in the Assault Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The Warlord and his unit may Run and still make Snap Shots with any Melta, Plasma or Flame Weaponry they carry (Template Weapons go to D3 hits if in range). While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Shooting Phase.

rules.name: Here and No Further!
rules.description: The moment that the controlling player receives a victory point due to the Sacred Trust special rule, both Harath Shen and his unit gain the Fearless and Counter Attack (2) Special Rules, In addition they also gain the Line unit subtype. In addition, while Harath Shen is alive, the controlling player may make an additional reaction in the Assault Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: If Master Harath Shen is your armies warlord then he and any unit he joins gets the Here and No Further! Special Rule.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The warlord and any unit he joins automatically passes Pinning tests. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Movement Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: If Lias Issodon is your army’s warlord, you may select up to 3 units with the Infantry or Cavalry Unit type and the Chapter Tactics (Raptors) Special rule to gain the Infiltrate Special Rule as well as the Skirmish sub-Type. In addition to this, while Lias Issodon is alive, the controlling player may make an additional reaction in the Shooting phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The Warlord and any unit he joins gain the Deep Strike Special rule. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Assault Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: If Asterion Moloc is your Warlord, then all models with the Chapter Tactics (Minotaurs) gain Preferred Enemy (Space Marines). If they already have that special rule, the also gain the Hatred (Space Marines) rule as well. A Primary Detachment that includes Asterion Moloc treats all allied forces as Desperate Allies. In addition to the above rules, while Asterion Moloc is alive the controlling player may make an additional reaction in the Movement Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text:
If Enkomi is the army’s Warlord, then all enemy units within 12" of Enkomi must use the squads lowest leadership instead of its highest for any Morale or Pinning Leadership Tests.

In addition to this, while Enkomi is alive, the controlling player may make an additional Reaction in the Assault Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The Warlord and any unit he has joined may reroll charge distance when charging into existing combat where a model (on either side) has already been slain. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Movement Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: If Tyberos if your warlord, then both he and any Infantry unit he joins gains the Preferred Enemy (Infantry) special rule. In addition while Tyberos the Red Wake is alive, the controlling player may make an additional reaction in the Movement Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The Warlord and any unit he joins is completely immune to any psychic attacks or weapons. He may never join a unit with the Psyker sub-type for any reason (Meaning he cannot take a retinue of Enochian Guard). While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Assault Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: If Silas Alberec is your army’s warlord, any friendly Space Marine units in a force that includes Alberec may re-roll failed pinning checks, while Alberect himself has the Feel No Pain (5+) universal special rule.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: While the Warlord is embarked on a vehicle, any other vehicle within 12" of the Warlords’ Vehicle may increase its move characteristic by +2". While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Movement Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: While the Warlord is alive, the controlling player may reroll all 1’s when rolling for reserves. The Warlord and his unit may also re-roll their charge moves on a turn they arrive from reserve. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Shooting Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: If you include Knight-Captain Courbray is the armies warlord, then all flamer weapons count as twin-linked. In addition while Knight-Captain Courbray is alive, the controlling player may make an additional reaction in the Movement Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The warlord and all friendly units within 6", add +1 to their initiative for any Run moves or Movement Reactions. While the Warlord is alive, the controlling player may make an additional reaction in the Movement Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The warlord and any unit he joins gains both the Line Sub-Type and the Heart of the Chapter Special Rule. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Assault Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: All Terminator Squads get the Line unit sub-type. While Blaylock is alive, the controlling player may make an additional reaction in any phase (only 1 addiontal reaction per player turn).

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The warlord and all friendly units within 12", add +1 to their results when rolling for charge distance. In addition, while the warlord is alive the army may make an additional reaction in the movement phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: If Sevrin Loth is the armies Warlord, the Primary detachment may take a single additional force organisation slot from the following list; Elites, Fast Attack, Heavy Support. In addition to this, while Sevrin Loth is alive the controlling player may make an additional Reaction in the Assault Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The Warlord and any unit he joins gains the Battle Hardened (1) Special Rule. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Shooting Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: If Vaylund Cal is the armies warlord, then he gains the Fear (1) Special rule. In addition while Vaylund Cal is is alive, the controlling player may make an additional Reaction in the Shooting Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The Warlord and unit he joins lose the One Shot rule from any Combi-melta or Combi-plasma weapons the unit carries. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Assault Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text:
An army led by a model with the Supreme Commander (X) Rule may, if it choses, take 0-1 choices of any non Unique, Non HQ unit from any other army within their faction.

For instance, in an army led by Carab Culln, he could take a Tactical Squad with Chapter Tactics (Raptors) or an Assault Squad with Chapter Tactics (Marines Errant) in his Primary Detachment, counting the unit for all intents and purposes as part of the Primary Detachment.

modifiers.value: To add a unit from another Chapter add Allied Chapter Unit force in the Primary Detachment

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text:
Given Culln’s overall command during most of the Badab war, he could readily call on almost all of the forces under his command, weather that be fleet assets, Astartes strike forces, or even requisitioning Inquisitorial troops, they would all fight as a
single, unified force under Culln’s exceptional command.

If Carab Culln is the army’s warlord, the army may take an additional Allied Detachment (2 Allied Detachments in total). In addition to this all Allies count as one better than they would usually be on the allied chart when fighting under Carab Culln. Eg. If two of the detachments were "By The Tyrant’s/High Commander’s Command", they would instead become "Distrusted Allies" Instead. Also if Carab Culln is involved in a challenge, he gains +1 to hit while he remains in a challenge.

In Addition to this while Culln is alive, the controlling player may make an additional reaction in any phase (only 1 additionalreaction per player turn).

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: Any combat with at least one friendly model within 12" of this Warlord, or a combat which includes this Warlord, gains a bonus of +1 to the number of Wounds caused for the purposes of combat resolution. In addition, an army whose Warlord has this Trait may make an additional Reaction during their opponent’s Assault phase as long as the Warlord has not been removed as a casualty.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: When this Warlord, and any unit it has joined, Runs during the Movement phase, it adds the value of the Warlord’s Initiative Characteristic, increased by 1, to the distance moved, rather than the lowest Initiative Characteristic in the unit. In addition, an army whose Warlord has this Trait may make an additional Reaction during their opponent’s Movement phase as long as the Warlord has not been removed as a casualty.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: When this Warlord or any friendly unit joined by a Warlord with this Trait makes a Shooting attack, the target unit must make a Pinning test if it suffers any unsaved Wounds. In addition, an army whose Warlord has this Trait may make an additional Reaction during their opponent’s Shooting phase as long as the Warlord has not been removed as a casualty.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text:
All of the controlling player's units with the Chapter Tactics (X) special rule within 6" of a friendly model with a Chapter standard are considered to have a Leadership Characteristic of 10 when resolving Morale checks or Pinning tests (but not Psychic checks).

In addition, all models in a unit that includes a Chapter standard gain the Line Sub-type as long as they remain part of that unit. Also the unit containing a Chapter Standard gains +1 to combat resolution. If any reason a combat is drawn, the unit with the Chapter Standard instead wins the combat by 1. If both units have a Chapter Standard, there is no bonus. These benefits are lost immediately if the model with the Chapter Standard is removed as a casualty, in addition the enemy gains D3 Victory Points

rules.name: Explorator Augury Web
rules.description:
At the start of each of the controlling player’s turns, that player may choose to activate the explorator augury web in either Disruption or Relay mode, the effects of which last until the beginning of the controlling player’s next turn:


- Disruption Mode: Any Reserves rolls made by an enemy player to bring units into play from Reserve are modified by -1 while this mode is active. This modifier does not stack with any other negative modifiers to Reserves rolls – use the highest single modifier instead. However, once the final negative modifier to a Reserves roll is determined, it can be reduced by any positive modifiers applied to the roll (for example if a Reserves roll was affected by both a -1 and +1 modifier then they would cancel each other and no modifier would be applied).


- Relay Mode: Any Reserves rolls made by the controlling player to bring units into play from Reserves may be re-rolled while this mode is active.

rules.name: Repair
rules.description: If a Rhino is Immobilised, then in subsequent turns, it may attempt to repair itself instead of shooting. To make the attempt, roll a D6 in the Shooting phase; on the roll of a 6+, the vehicle is no longer Immobilised. Note that a successful Repair does not restore a Hull Point

rules.name: Storm Shield
rules.description: A model with a storm shield gains a 3+ Invulnerable Save, Invulnerable Saves granted by a storm shield do not stack with other Invulnerable Saves, and cannot be modified by any other special rule. If a model has another Invulnerable Save then the controlling player must choose one to use. A model with a storm shield may never gain an additional Attack for being armed with two close combat weapons or make attacks using a weapon with the Twohanded special rule.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: As long as a model with this special rule is deployed on the battlefield, the controlling player may choose to re-roll all failed Reserves roll they make.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: While any model with the Character Sub-type is Embarked upon a model with this special rule, friendly units with the same version of the Legiones Astartes special rule that are within 18" or that include a model with a nuncio-vox may use the Embarked model’s Leadership Characteristic for Morale checks and Pinning tests. If more than one model with the Character Sub-type is Embarked upon a model with this special rule then the controlling player chooses which model’s Leadership Characteristic is used.

rules.name: Iron Bulwark
rules.description: If a unit includes at least three models with the Iron Bulwark Special rule and is not locked in combat, all friendly models in that unit (including those without Iron Bulwark) gain the Battle- Hardened (1) Special Rule for the duration of any Assault Phase in which they charge or are charged by one or more enemy units.

characteristics.$text: If a unit contains a Squad banner, if for any reason a combat is drawn, the unit with the Squad Banner instead wins the combat by 1. If both units have a Squad Banner, there is no bonuses.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: Tempest, Kraken and Vengeance Rounds may be used in Bolters, Storm Bolters and the Bolter half of any combiweapon.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model with an ferromantic deflector gains a 5+ Invulnerable Save and any model with a ferromantic deflector and a Wounds Characteristic that suffers an unsaved Wound with the Instant Death special rule is not immediately removed as a casualty, but instead loses three Wounds instead of one for each unsaved Wound with the Instant Death special rule inflicted on it. In addition, when a model with a ferromantic deflector loses its last Wound or Hull Point, but before it is removed as a casualty or replaced with a Wreck, all models both friendly and enemy within D6" suffer an automatic Hit at Str 6, AP -.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model with an atomantic deflector gains a 5+ Invulnerable Save and any model with an atomantic deflector and a Wounds Characteristic that suffers an unsaved Wound with the Instant Death special rule is not immediately removed as a casualty, but instead loses D3 Wounds instead of one for each unsaved Wound with the Instant Death special rule inflicted on it. In addition, when a model with an atomantic deflector loses its last Wound or Hull Point, but before it is removed as a casualty or replaced with a Wreck, all models both friendly and enemy within D6" suffer an automatic Hit at Str 8, AP -.

characteristics.$text:
Centurion armour increases a Marines statline by +1 Strength, +1 Toughness and +2 Wounds, as well as conveying a 2+ Armour save, Heavy Unit Sub-Type and the Move Through Cover, Bulky (3) and Relentless Special Rules*.

*Already included in the above statlines

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model equipped with ironclad assault launchers does not suffer the penalty to its Initiative for charging enemies through difficult terrain. Furthermore, enemies charging a model equipped with ironclad assault launchers do not gain bonus Attacks from charging unless the model was already locked in combat from a previous turn.

characteristics.$text: A model with an omniscope has the Night Vision and Split Fire special rules

rules.name: Specialist Detachment
rules.description: Any model with this special rule must be attached to an infantry unit (or cavalry if equipped with a Astartes Combat Bike) at the beginning of a battle before deployment. If it cannot be deployed with a unit it counts as destroyed. They may not join a unit consisting of models with Terminator (any kind) or Centurion Armour. If the unit has any particular Sub-Types (EG Heavy, Light, Skirmish etc) this model then gains them.

rules.name: Fatal Strike
rules.description: Once per game, a Raptor Reconnaissance Squad may execute a fatal strike attack against a chosen target. The Reconnaissance Squad’s controlling player declares the Fatal strike at the start of one of the squad’s Shooting phases. For the duration of that phase, the squad’s shooting attacks have both the Twin-linked and Rending (6+) special rules, in addition to any other effects their weapons might have. In the case of weapons already with the Rending (X) Special rule, increase it by 1,eg during the Fatal Strike a weapon with Rending (6+) would go to Rending (5+) for the duration of the attack.

characteristics.$text: If a model with a Locator Beacon is on the battlefield at the start of the player turn, any Deepstrike/Drop Pod Assaults that occur may chose to place their first model within 12" of the model with the Locator Beacon. If this is done, do not roll to scatter the original model, simply deploy it as if it had not scattered. In addition to this, all following units automatically pass any Disruption rolls they would be required to make.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: Friendly units composed entirely of models in Terminator armour do not scatter when they Deep Strike not can terminator models teleporting into the battlefield have their deepstrike become disordered, so long as the first model is placed within 6" of the teleport homer’s bearer. For this to work, the bearer of the teleport homer must have been on the battlefield at the start of the turn.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text:
The controlling player of a model with a helical targeting array may activate it at the start of any of their own turns, or, if the controlling player is not taking the first turn of the battle, at the start of the battle, before the beginning of the opposing player’s first turn. Once the helical targeting array is activated, the model is affected by the following conditions until the beginning of the controlling player’s next turn:

- The model may not move, Run or declare or make any Reactions other than the Interceptor or Overwatch Reaction.
- The controlling player may choose to use the Skyfire special rule when making any Shooting Attacks with the model.
- No model may make a Damage Mitigation roll provided by the Shrouded special rule against an attack made by a model with a helical targeting array while it is active.
- When the model makes a Shooting Attack as part of the Interceptor Reaction, the Reaction does not cost the controlling player a point from their Reaction Allotment. This does not allow the unit to make more than one Reaction per Phase, but does allow the controlling player to exceed the normal three Reactions limit in a given Phase.
- When a model with the Vehicle Unit Type and a helical targeting array makes a Shooting Attack as part of the Interceptor Reaction, that model may fire all of its weapons, not just Defensive Weapons, as part of the Shooting Attack.

selectionEntryGroups.name: May take one of the following

rules.name: Siege Shield
rules.description: A siege Shield Conveys all the benefits of a Dozer Blade, in addition any model with a Siege Shield counts its cover save as 1 better than usual (a 6+ in the open) if the the front of the Vehicle is being fired at

rules.name: Bastion Breacher Protocol
rules.description: If a Vindicator Squadron consists of 2 or more models all equipped with Demolisher Cannons it may elect to enact Bastion Breaker Protocol at the start of any of its owning players turns. If enacted, the squadron may not move for any reason (including pivoting on the spot) in the controlling players movement phase. In the owning players shooting phase the squadron may elect to fire a Bastion Breacher Fusilade instead of any other weapons (note if a Vehicle couldn't fire it's Demolisher cannon due to a Weapon Destroyed, Crew Shaken or is facing the wrong way to fire a t the same target, it does not count for the amount of tanks firing). If it does so it uses the Bastion Breacher Fusilade weapon profile (measure from any of the tanks).

selectionEntryGroups.name: Must take two of the following

rules.name: Mortis Targeter
rules.description:
The controlling player of a model with a Mortis Targeter may activate it at the start of any of their own turns, or, if the controlling player is not taking the first turn of the battle, at the start of the battle, before the beginning of the opposing player’s first turn. Once the Mortis Targeter is activated, the model is affected by the following conditions until the beginning of the controlling player’s next turn:


- The model may not move, Run or declare or make any Reactions other than the Interceptor or Overwatch Reaction.


- The controlling player may choose to use the Skyfire special rule when making any Shooting Attacks with the model.


- When the model makes a Shooting Attack as part of the Interceptor Reaction, the Reaction does not cost the controlling player a point from their Reaction Allotment. This does not allow the unit to make more than one Reaction per Phase, but does allow the controlling player to exceed the normal three Reactions limit in a given Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text:
At the start of each of the controlling player’s turns, that player may choose to activate the explorator augury web in either Disruption or Relay mode, the effects of which last until the beginning of the controlling player’s next turn:

- Disruption Mode: Any Reserves rolls made by an enemy player to bring units into play from Reserve are modified by -1 while this mode is active. This modifier does not stack with any other negative modifiers to Reserves rolls – use the highest single modifier instead. However, once the final negative modifier to a Reserves roll is determined, it can be reduced by any positive modifiers applied to the roll (for example if a Reserves roll was affected by both a -1 and +1 modifier then they would cancel each other and no modifier would be applied).

- Relay Mode: Any Reserves rolls made by the controlling player to bring units into play from Reserves may be re-rolled while this mode is active.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: Any unit charging into close combat on the same turn as it disembarks from a transport vehicle equipped with frag assault launchers counts as having frag grenades.

rules.name: Ferromantic Invulnerability
rules.description: The effects of any variant of the Armourbane special rule or the Lance special rule are ignored when resolving attacks made against a model with this special rule.

rules.name: Galvanic Traction Drive
rules.description: A model with this special rule must reroll failed Dangerous Terrain tests.

sharedSelectionEntries.name: Land Raider Spartan Heavy Assault Carrier

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model with a flare shield reduces the strength of Shooting Attacks made against its Front Armour by -1, or -2 if that Shooting Attack has the Blast special rule or uses a template to determine its Range. A flare shield has no effect on Shooting Attacks inflicted with weapons of the Destroyer type.

entryLinks.name: Two Sponson Mounted Hurricane Bolter Arrays

rules.name: Note on Transport Capacity
rules.description: The Stormraven Gunship can carry two separate units: one unit of up to 12 models in its cabin, plus a single Castraferrum Dreadnought. All the usual Vehicle Transport rules apply, except in the case of the dreadnought. Instead of a S8 hit if the vehicle explodes, the Castraferrum Dreadnought receives a S12 hit instead. If the Stormraven Crashes and Burns, the Castraferrum Dreadnought instead receives D3 S12, AP1 hits.

entryLinks.name: Two Sponson Mounted Gravis Autocannon Batteries
Two Sponson Mounted Gravis Heavy Bolter Batteries

rules.name: Caestus Ram
rules.description: Contrary to the usual rules for Flyers, a Caestus may in fact Ram and Tank Shock like any normal vehicle. When conducting a ram attack, the Caestus’ controlling player can roll two dice and pick the higher number when determining if it has penetrated the target’s armour and add +1 to any rolls on the Vehicle Damage chart that it uses. The Caestus Assault Ram conducts all of its ramming attacks at Strength 10, in addition to its other rules Note a Caestus may only Ram/Tank Shock a unit that is in the same mode as it. E.G. It may not Ram a zooming flyer if it is hovering, nor may it tank shock an infantry unit while it is zooming. In addition, the Caestus has an invulnerable save of 5+ against any attacks against its Front armour, including any damage it suffers as a result of carrying out a ram or being rammed itself from the front.

rules.name: Misericord
rules.description: Caestus Assault Ram has a transport capacity of 6 models, but counts any models with the Bulky (X) Special rule as one less than usual. Meaning it could fit 12 terminator-armoured marines within it, or up to 4 centurion-armoured marines. It may not however transport Jump Infantry.

entryLinks.name: Two Centerline Mounted Typhoon Missile Launchers
Two Turret Mounted Twin-linked Heavy Bolters

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model with a ramjet diffraction grid reduces the Strength of Shooting Attacks made against its Rear or Side armour by -1, or -2 if that attack has the Blast special rule or uses a template to determine its Range. A ramjet diffraction grid has no effect on attacks inflicted with weapons of the Destroyer type.

characteristics.name: Special Rules
characteristics.$text: Massive Blast (7”), Rending (4+), Pinning, Shell Shock (1)

rules.name: Two Auxiliary Vehicle Bays
rules.description: In addition to being able to be used independently, both Thunderhawk Transporter Auxiliary Vehicle Bays can be used together to transport a model with the Vehicle Unit Type and a starting Hull Point value of up to 8.

rules.name: Chapter Tactics (X)
rules.description:
The various Chapters are differentiated by means of the Chapter Tactics (X) special rule. When assembling an Adeptus Astartes army, a single variation of the Chapter Tactics (X) special rule is chosen and no unit in the Primary Detachment may include any models with a different variation of this special rule. All special rules, Wargear options and Rites of War that apply to that version of the
Chapter Tactics (X) special rule may be used by the army where appropriate, as defined by those rules and options.


Other Detachments in the army, such as Allied Detachments or Lords of War Detachments, may have a different version of the Chapter Tactics (X) special rule. In which case no models in the same Detachment may have a different version of the Chapter Tactics (X) special rule to the one chosen for that Detachment. Models within a non-Primary Detachment are affected by all the special rules for the version of the Chapter Tactics (X) special rule chosen for them, as well as access to any Wargear options and special units.

rules.name: Sanguinary Priest
rules.description: All Infantry models with Chapter Tactics (Lamenters) in a unit that includes at least one Sanguinary Priest adds +1 to their Weapon Skill.

rules.name: Cutting Strike
rules.description: Any to Hit Roll of a 6 with this weapon automatically wounds.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: If the bearer is wounded by a weapon with the Brutal (X) rule, subtract 1 from the Brutal (X) rule to a minimum of 1.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: Cataphractii Terminator Armour confers a 2+ Armour Save and a 4+ Invulnerable Save. A unit that includes any models with Cataphractii Terminator Armour may not make Sweeping Advances. A model equipped with Cataphractii Terminator Armour gains Heavy Sub-type.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: Indomitus Terminator Armour confers a 2+ Armour Save and a 5+ Invulnerable Save. A unit that includes any models with Indomitus Terminator Armour gains Deep Strike Special Rule and may not make Sweeping Advances. A model equipped with Indomitus Terminator Armour gains Heavy Sub-type.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: Tartaros Terminator Armour confers a 2+ Armour Save and a 5+ Invulnerable Save.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model with the Extra Armour Wargear counts a Crew Stunned result on the Vehicle Damage Table as Crew Shaken instead.

modifiers.value: must be attached to an Independent Character

rules.name: Cloaked in Honour
rules.description: Whenever a unit containing models with this special rule declares a charge targeting a unit already engaged in combat, the charge roll gains an additional +1 modifier, if the charge is successful then all models in the charging unit with the Cloaked in Honour special rule gain +1 to hit for the duration of the turn in which that charge is made.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The controlling player may choose to have a model with a breacher charge that is Engaged or otherwise in base contact during the Assault phase with a Building or Fortification model, inflict one automatic Str 10, AP 2 Hit on the target in Initiative Step 1 instead of attacking normally. Any model in a unit that is chosen to inflict Hits using breacher charges may not otherwise attack or make use of any other special rule or item of Wargear that inflicts Hits or Wounds on a model in the same Assault phase (but may participate in Sweeping Advances as normal).

modifiers.value: selection must be removed and reselected again manually.

entryLinks.name: Land Raider Spartan Heavy Assault Carrier

modifiers.value: selection must be removed and reselected again manually.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A Death Mask gives the model wearing it the Fear (1) and Stubborn Special Rules.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model with a scout armour gains a 4+ Save.

sharedRules.name: And They Shall Know No Fear
sharedRules.description:
A unit containing at least one model with the And They Shall Know No Fear and Chapter Tactics (X) Special Rules automatically pass tests to regroup. In addition to this a unit with both the And They Shall Know No Fear and Chapter Tactics (X) can not be Sweeping Advanced unless the enemy unit also has a model with both the And They Shall Know No Fear and Chapter Tactics (X) Special Rules. If retreating unit is caught in a sweeping advance by a unit without a model with the And They Shall Know No Fear and Chapter Tactics (X) rule the simply continue to fight as normal.

(Designers Note: Essentially Marines can Sweep Marines, but a unit of Tyrant's Legion Auxilia can not sweep a unit of space marines.)

sharedRules.name: Master of the Company
sharedRules.description:
The Master of the Company special rule grants the following benefits:

- Company Level Deployment: If a Detachment with the Legiones Astartes Faction includes at least one model with the Master of the Company special rule then that Detachment may select a single Company Level Deployment. Company Level Deployments are presented in the Appendix: Badab Chapters Company Level Deployments.

- The Few and the Proud: An army may only include a maximum of one model with this special rule. This counts across all Detachments of an army and includes named characters with the Master of the Company special rule.

- Retinue: A model with this special rule may also include a Command Squad or Terminator Command Squad as part of the same Force Organisation slot as the model with the Master of the Company special rule.

sharedRules.name: Chapter Specialist
sharedRules.description:
A Force Commander may be upgraded with one of the following titles, no model may take more than one such upgrade, nor can multiple models with the same title be taken in a detachment.


- Codicier Librarian
- Master of the Signals
- Lord Executioner
- Master of the Forge
- Reclusiarch
- Master of the Recruits
- Master of the Keep
- Chapter Ancient
- Master of the Arsenal
- Master of the Relics

sharedRules.name: Combat Squads
sharedRules.description:
A unit with this special rule numbering 10 or more models have the option of breaking down into multiple 5 man units. If the starting number of models (not including attached Characters, Apothecaries or Techmarines) is not divisible by 5 the unit may not combat squad (eg a unit of 15 Space Marines could combat squad into 3 groups, but a unit of 12 Space Marines could not combat squad at all).

The decision to split the unit into combat squads, as well as which models go into each combat squad must be made when the unit is deployed. All combat squads can be deployed in separate locations. The one exceptions to this is a unit that arrives by Drop Pod. The player can choose to split such a unit into combat squads when it disembarks from a Drop Pod. If you decide to split a unit into combat squads, then each combat is treated as a separate unit for all game purposes from that point, including for kill points.

sharedRules.name: Harbingers of the Chapter
sharedRules.description: A unit that includes any models with this special rule may not join or be joined by any model that does not also have this special rule (this includes Techmarines and Apothecaries, which may not be assigned to units that includes any models with this rule). In addition, a unit that includes any models with this special rule never counts as a Scoring unit or a Denial unit regardless of any other special rules or Mission rules in however, a model with this special rule may re-roll failed Shrouded and Damage Mitigation rolls.

sharedRules.name: Heart of the Chapter
sharedRules.description: When a unit that includes at least one model with this special rule has at least half of its models within 6" of an Objective then all models in the unit gain the Feel No Pain (6+) and Stubborn special rules. lf any model in the unit already has a variant of the Feel No Pain special rule then instead increase the value in brackets of one of those rules by + 1 while the unit has at least half of its models within 6" of an Objective (for example, a model that already had Feel No Pain (S+) could choose to increase this to Feel No Pain (4+) while it fulfils the conditions of this special rule).

sharedRules.name: Heroic Intervention
sharedRules.description: A unit with this special rule may re-roll one or both dice when attempting to charge. Furthermore, a unit with this rule ignores the penalty for a disordered charge.

sharedRules.name: Specialist Detachment
sharedRules.description: Any model with this special rule must be attached to an infantry unit (or cavalry if equipped with an Astartes Combat Bike) at the beginning of a battle before deployment. If it cannot be deployed with a unit it counts as destroyed. They may not join a unit consisting of models with Terminator (any kind) or Centurion Armour. If the unit has any particular Sub-Types (EG Heavy, Light Skirmish etc) this model then gains them.

sharedRules.name: Heavy Assault Drop
sharedRules.description: A model deploying from Deep Strike Assault that is exiting a Dreadnought Drop Pod may ignoring any restrictions on charging when arriving form Reserves. In addition, if a model has deployed out of a Dreadnought Drop Pod and stays wholly within 4" it receives the Shrouded (5+) special rule until the start of the controlling players following turn. (It will get the shrouded save against any interceptor fire the turn it arrives).

sharedRules.name: Chapter Artillerists
sharedRules.description: A Chapter Thunderfire Cannon Battery must have one Techmarine Gunner per Thunderfire Carriage in order for all Thunderfire Carriages to make Shooting Attacks in the Shooting phase. If, at the start ofany of the controlling player’s Shooting phases, the Chapter Thunderfire Cannon Battery contains fewer Techmarine Gunners than Thunderfire Carriages then only a number of Thunderfire Carriages equal to the number of Techmarine Gunners may make Shooting Attacks in that Shooting phase. In addition, as long as there are at least as many Techmarine Gunners in the unit as there are Thunderfire Carriages then the unit cannot be Pinned, automatically passing any Pinning tests it is called upon to take without any dice being rolled, and all Techmarine Gunners in the unit gain a bonus of +1 to their Toughness and Leadership Characteristics (this bonus is lost immediately once the number of Techmarine Gunners is reduced to less than the number of Thunderfire Carriage s in the unit).

sharedRules.name: Savant Lock
sharedRules.description: If any shot from a weapon with this special rule misses anything with the Flyer, Flying Monstrous Creature, Hover or Antigrav unit sub- roll a D6 at the start of the next friendly Shooting phase if the target unit is still on the battlefield and has not been destroyed. On a 5+, the target unit suffers a hit (using its rear Armour Value if it is a vehicle) with the profile above.

sharedRules.name: Area Denial Drop
sharedRules.description:
Before the start of the first turn, when placing units into Reserve, a player must assign all models with this special rule in the army to Reserve to perform an Area Denial Drop. At the beginning of the controlling player’s first turn, before any other models are moved or deployed, all of the Area Denial Drop units must enter play using the procedure described below: Performing an Area Denial Drop When deploying the Area Denial Drop, the controlling player selects one of the available units to deploy first. Place a single model from that unit anywhere on the battlefield that is at least 6" from any enemy model, battlefield edge or piece of Impassable Terrain and is outside of all Deployment Zones. Do not scatter the model.

If possible, the model must be placed in a position that will allow any other models in the same unit to deploy (as follows), and may only be placed in a position that denies the remainder of the squad a place within unit coherency if no other position is available. Once the model’s final position has been decided, the remainder of the unit may be deployed anywhere that is within unit coherency and more than 6" from any enemy model or piece of Impassable
Terrain. Any models that cannot be placed are removed as casualties.


Once this first unit has been deployed, roll a D6. On the roll of a ‘1’, the Area Denial Drop is Disordered and the opposing player may deploy each remaining unit in the Area Denial Drop anywhere within 12" of the first unit without scattering, though no model may be within 1" of an enemy model or within Impassable Terrain. If the roll is a ‘2’ or higher, the controlling player deploys each remaining unit anywhere within 12" of the first without scattering, though no model may be within 1" of an enemy model or within Impassable Terrain.


Once all units are deployed from the Area Denial Drop they may each of them may fire any weapons with the Deathstorm special rule, for this attack only they have both the Pinning and Shellshock (1) special rules also.


Once this is done, enemy units may make interceptor attacks at the units that arrived as per usual.

Once all units from the Area Denial Drop have been deployed and any Interceptor Reactions have been resolved, the turn proceeds as normal. Units that have been deployed as part of an Area Denial Drop may not Move or Run in the Movement phase of the turn in which they are deployed, but may Shoot and declare Charges as normal (if the models deployed as part of the Area Denial Drop are allowed to make Charges).

sharedRules.name: Relic of the Chapter
sharedRules.description: An army may only have one unit with the Relics of the Chapter special rule for every full 1000 points that the army is made up of. This is to represent ancient weaponry, warriors or vehicles only being called upon in the largest, most desperate battles.

sharedRules.name: Infantry Transport
sharedRules.description: No model with any version of the Bulky (X) special rule may Embark on a model that has this special rule.

sharedRules.name: Dreadnought Transport
sharedRules.description: A model with this special rule may transport a single model with the Dreadnought Unit Type. A Dreadnought model may not Embark upon a model with this special rule if any other models are already Embarked on it, and while a Dreadnought model is Embarked on a model with this special rule then no other models may Embark.

sharedRules.name: Deathstorm
sharedRules.description: When making a Shooting Attack, select up to four enemy units within range and line of sight of the attacking unit and make a Shooting Attack using the weapon’s profile against each unit instead of following the normal procedure (any individual enemy unit may only be selected as a target once, and if there are less than four enemy units within line of sight and range then each viable target may be attacked). Each unit targeted is attacked with the full number of attacks listed as part of the weapon’s profile, for example, a weapon with the Heavy 6 type and the Deathstorm special rule would select up to four enemy units within range and line of sight and roll six dice To Hit against each unit.

sharedRules.name: Aerial Weapons Platform
sharedRules.description: A Lumbering model with this special rule may fire all of its weapons in the shooting phase as if it was a Super-Heavy Vehicle. In addition to this, it may (contrary to the rulebook) make a Return Fire action with any turret mounted weapons against any model with the Flyer Sub-Type that fired at it.

sharedRules.name: Chapter Master
sharedRules.description: A Model with this special rule also has the Master of the Company Special rule. In addition, if this model is fielded it must be a part of the Primary Detachment and must be the armies Warlord. Due to the truly legendary prospect of a Chapter Master taking to the field of battle, an army may also take an additional Elites choice.

sharedRules.name: The Black Rage
sharedRules.description: A unit with this special rule may only ever be joined by a Reclusiarchs. They may also never score, no matter what.

sharedRules.name: Chapter Tactics (Lamenters)
sharedRules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Lamenters) Special Rule gains Encarmine Fury and Maelstrom Warder Special Rules.

sharedRules.name: Chapter Tactics (Executioners)
sharedRules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Executioners) Special Rule gains Bitter Mettle and Headhunters Special Rules.

sharedRules.name: Chapter Tactics (Marines Errant)
sharedRules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Marines Errant) Special Rule gains Fervent Fighters Special Rule.

sharedRules.name: Orbital Strike
sharedRules.description: This Attacker always scatters even if a hit is rolled, use the small arrow on the Hit! Dice to determine direction of scatter.

sharedRules.name: Chapter Tactics (Salamanders)
sharedRules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Salamanders) Special Rule gains Blood of Fire Special Rule.

sharedRules.name: Scout
sharedRules.description:
After both sides have deployed (including Infiltrators), but before the first player begins their first turn, a unit containing at least one model with this special rule can choose to redeploy. If the unit is Infantry, Artillery, Dreadnought or Automata, each model can redeploy anywhere entirely within 6" of its current position. If it is any other Unit Type, each model can instead redeploy anywhere entirely within 12" of its current position. During this redeployment, Scouts can move outside the owning player’s Deployment Zone, but must remain more than 9" away from any enemy unit. A unit that makes a Scout redeployment cannot Charge in the first Game Turn. A unit cannot Embark or Disembark as part of a Scout redeployment.

If both sides have Scouts, roll off; the winner decides who redeploys first. Then alternate redeploying Scout units one at a time. If a unit with this special rule is deployed inside a Dedicated Transport, it confers the Scout special rule to the Transport (though a Disembarkation cannot be performed as part of the redeployment). Note that a Transport with this special rule does not lose it if a unit without this special rule is Embarked upon it. Having Scout also confers the Outflank special rule to units of Scouts that are kept as Reserves.

sharedRules.name: Chapter Tactics (Raptors)
sharedRules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Raptors) Special Rule gains Strike from the Shadows and Legendary Marksmen Special Rules.

sharedRules.name: Chapter Tactics (Minotaurs)
sharedRules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Minotaurs) Special Rule gains Unrelenting Assault and Trample and Crush Special Rules.

sharedRules.name: Dreadnought Talon
sharedRules.description: When deployed onto the battlefield (either at the start of the battle or when arriving from Reserves), all models with this special rule in a unit must be placed within unit coherency, but afterwards operate independently and are not treated as a unit.

sharedRules.name: Grav-ripple
sharedRules.description:
A weapon with the Grav-Ripple effect rolls to hit as normal. To wound it needs whatever the targets Armour save is (Eg if hitting a Space Marine with an armour save of 3+, you would require a 3+ to wound the Marine). Models wounded by a weapon with the Grav-Ripple trait do not make a normal saving through, but instead make save based on their Toughness. EG if a Guardsmen, at Toughness 3 is wounded by a Grav-Ripple Weapon, they will save the wound on a 3+.
(Let us know how this plays in your games, Wanted something not as busted as Grav in 6th/7th but not as useless as Graviton in HH 2.0, feedback is always wanted and encouraged!)

sharedRules.name: Impact-reactive Doors
sharedRules.description: When a model with this special rule is deployed, any doors on the model must be opened to their full extent. All models Embarked within a model with this special rule must then Disembark immediately and no models can thereafter Embark within that model for the remainder of the battle. Any model that has Disembarked from a model with this special rule may not have a Charge declared for it in the same turn. The physical doors attached to a model with this special rule are not treated as part of the model once opened and cannot be targeted by Shooting Attacks and do not impede Movement in any way.

sharedRules.name: Inertial Guidance System
sharedRules.description: When deployed as the first model placed during a Deep Strike Assault, or other deployment that requires a model with this special rule to scatter, the distance the model scatters is reduced by half and if it scatters into Impassable Terrain or off of the battlefield then it is moved the minimum distance required to avoid such obstacles. In addition, if all units included in a Deep Strike Assault have the Inertial Guidance System special rule or are models Embarked on a model with that special rule then any rolls made to determine if the Deep Strike Assault is Disordered may be re-rolled.

sharedRules.name: Inexorable
sharedRules.description: A unit that contains only models with this special rule ignores modifiers to Leadership when making a Morale check or Pinning test – except those caused by the Fear (X) special rule or the Corrupted and Anathema Sub-types. If a unit has both the Fearless and Inexorable special rules, it uses the rules for Fearless instead of Inexorable.

sharedRules.name: Limited Ammunition
sharedRules.description: After all Shooting Attacks for a weapon with this special rule have been fully resolved, roll a D6, adding +1 if the weapon has fired before in the same battle. If the total of this roll is 6 or more then the weapon may no longer be used to make Shooting Attacks in this battle. If this weapon is unable to make further Shooting Attacks then it may not be targeted by a Weapon Destroyed result on the Vehicle Damage table, and for the purposes of such a result is treated as though it had already been destroyed.

sharedRules.name: Marked for Death
sharedRules.description: At the start of the battle, once both armies have set up all their models, including any units with the Infiltrator special rule, a single enemy unit may be chosen by a player that controls any models with this special rule – this unit is considered ‘marked for death’. When any models with this special rule controlled by that player are used to make an attack of any kind against the enemy unit their controlling player has ‘marked for death’, all failed To Wound rolls of ‘1’ may be re-rolled.

sharedRules.name: Orbital Assault Vehicle
sharedRules.description: A model with this special rule must be deployed onto the battlefield as part of a Deep Strike Assault, or other deployment that requires the Deep Strike special rule. It may never be deployed as normal, regardless of any other rule or mission, and if forced to do so it is immediately reduced to 0 Hull Points and replaced with a Wreck (any models Embarked within must make an Emergency Disembarkation). Furthermore, a model with this special rule may never move – and if forced to do so is immediately reduced to 0 Hull Points and replaced with a Wreck (any models Embarked within must make an Emergency Disembarkation).

sharedRules.name: Reaping Blow
sharedRules.description: If a model is in base contact with more than one enemy model in the Initiative step in which they fight, they gain a number of Attacks equal to the value of X as noted in the variant of the special rule (if no value of X is included then count the value of X as 1).

sharedRules.name: Retinue
sharedRules.description: A Legion Command Squad, Legion Cataphractii Terminator Command Squad or Legion Tartaros Command Squad may only be selected as part of a Detachment that includes at least one model with the Master of the Company special rule. A unit selected in this manner is considered a ‘Retinue Squad’ and the model with the Master of the Company special rule is referred to as the Retinue Squad’s Leader for the purposes of this special rule (if the Detachment includes more than one model with the Master of the Company  special rule then the controlling player selects one as the unit’s Leader). The Retinue Squad does not use up a Force Organisation slot and is considered part of the same unit as the model selected as its Leader. The Retinue Squad must be deployed with the model selected as its Leader deployed as part of the unit and the Leader may not voluntarily leave the Retinue Squad during play. A Legion Command Squad, Legion Cataphractii Terminator Command Squad or Legion Tartaros Command Squad may not be selected as part of an army without a Leader.

sharedRules.name: Transport Bay
sharedRules.description: A model with this special rule may carry models of the Dreadnought and Automata Unit Types, as well as models with the Cavalry Unit Type but not the Antigrav Sub-type. Each Dreadnought model uses 10 points of Transport Capacity, while each Automata and Cavalry model uses up a number of Transport Capacity points equal to twice its starting Wounds Characteristic.

sharedRules.name: Fervent Fighters
sharedRules.description: During a turn in which a unit made up entirely of models with the Marines Errant special rule successfully charges, or are successfully charged, the strength of all Melee attacks made against any model in that unit that does not have the Vehicle Unit Type suffers a modifier of -1.

sharedRules.name: Headhunters
sharedRules.description:
All character models with this special rule inflict Instant Death on a To Wound roll of 6 in a Challenge – roll saves against these attacks separately.

The character with the highest WS (if two or more characters are tied, then the controlling player must select one) in any assault with this special rule must always issue or accept a challenge in an assault if possible.

sharedRules.name: Bitter Mettle
sharedRules.description:
All models with Chapter Tactics (Executioners) special rule ignore all negative modifiers on a turn in which they charge or are charged (e.g. Ignore the negatives of Fear (1), or Rad Grenades -1 Toughness etc, charging through cover etc.

(Note-Use their baseline stats when being charged or on the charge (unless they benefit from Furious Charge (1) etc). TL:DR Ignore all negative stat modifiers).
-Badab Enthusiast)

sharedRules.name: Unrelenting Assault
sharedRules.description: Models with Chapter Tactics (Minotaurs) do not take Morale checks due to casualties in any shooting phase and may re-roll failed Pinning Checks. They may never make use of the Withdraw Reaction.

sharedRules.name: Trample and Crush
sharedRules.description: Models with Chapter Tactics (Minotaurs) gain the Crusader special rule. In addition, they add +1 to any roll to determine charge distances while in an enemy deployment zone.

sharedRules.name: Strike from the Shadows
sharedRules.description:
Models in this detachment have the Scout special rule. In addition, on the first game turn, models in the detachment have the Shrouded (6+) this may stack with any other version of the shrouded rule eg. Shrouded (5+) from Evade goes to Shrouded (4+) etc.

Note that units which contain models with any variant of the Bulky (x) special rule do not benefit from either rule.

sharedRules.name: Legendary Marksmen
sharedRules.description: Any unit with this special rule that does not move in the Movement phase of their turn or is not pinned, may choose to gain the Rending (6+) special rule when firing in the Shooting phase of that turn with boltguns, combi-weapons fired as boltguns or bolt pistols. When using this rule, such weapons are counted as being Heavy 1 instead of their usual type for that attack.

sharedRules.name: Encarmine Fury
sharedRules.description: All models with The Lamenters chapter tactic require one lower result to wound than they would normally, to a minimum of 2+, on any turn in which they are part of a successful charge against an enemy unit even if that Charge is counted as Disordered.

sharedRules.name: Maelstrom Warder
sharedRules.description: Any model with the Maelstrom Warder special rule counts its leadership as 1 higher (to a maximum of 10) when within its own deployment zone.

sharedRules.name: Blood of Fire
sharedRules.description: When rolling to wound against a model with this special rule for any attack inflicted by a flame, melta, or plasma weapon or effect, reduce the result of that roll To Wound by -1 (this does not affect the strength of the weapon, only the roll to wound). In addition, all models that have more than one wound or Hull point gain the It Will Not Die (6+) special rule.

sharedRules.name: Chapter Tactics (Carcharodons)
sharedRules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Carcharodons) Special Rule gains Blood Hunger Special Rule.

sharedRules.name: Blood Hunger
sharedRules.description: All units with Chapter Tactics (Carcharodons) gain the Blooded (x) special rule after they have either destroyed an enemy infantry or cavalry unit in an assault or forced one to Fall Back. Place a suitable marker on any unit that gains the Blooded (x) special rule to indicate this has occurred. For each additional unit destroyed or made to fall back, place another Blooded (x) token on the unit. When one of these marked units makes a consolidation move, it must move towards the nearest enemy unit.

sharedRules.name: Blooded (X)
sharedRules.description: A Model with the Blooded (X) special rule receives X amount of extra attacks on a turn it charges into combat, this is in addition to Rage (X), Rampage (X) etc. The X is the number of Blooded tokens the unit currently has. If there is an Independent Character within the unit that also has Blooded (X) tokens, simply pick the higher of the two token pools and use for the Blooded (X) special Rule.

sharedRules.name: Letting-talons
sharedRules.description: When a model has 2 Letting-talons they gain +2 Attacks instead of the usual +1 for using an additional weapon in combat.

sharedRules.name: Indomitable
sharedRules.description: All models with Chapter Tactics (Exorcists) gain the Battle Hardened (1) Special Rule. In addition a model with this special rule may never have its leadership characteristic modified below a value of 6 (Via Fear, Loss of Combat, Nightfight etc). Furthermore if one or more models with this special rule are part of a combat that results in a draw, then a side which includes one or more models with this special rule at the end of the fight sub-phase is counted at having won the combat by one point. If both sides include this rule, the combat remains a draw.

sharedRules.name: Gladius Incandor
sharedRules.description: All units with the chapter tactic (Fire Angels) gain a bonus +1 to hit when rolling To Hit with in an assault with one of the following weapons: Chainsword, Force Sword, Power Sword, Terranic Great Sword. In addition, models with the Vehicle Sub-type gain +1 Strength when making a ram action.

sharedRules.name: Chapter Tactics (Exorcists)
sharedRules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Exorcists) Special Rule gains Indomitable Special Rule.

sharedRules.name: Chapter Tactics (Fire Angels)
sharedRules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Fire Angels) Special Rule gains Gladius Incandor Special Rule.

sharedRules.name: Chapter Tactics (Fire Hawks)
sharedRules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Fire Hawks) Special Rule gains On Wings of Fire, Speed and Fury and The Livery of Curs Special Rules.

sharedRules.name: On Wings of Fire
sharedRules.description: All Flamer, Hand Flamer and Heavy Flamer attacks made by models with Chapter Tactics (Fire Hawks) gain +1 Strength on the turn in which the unit enters play using the Deep Strike special rule (including models exiting from Drop Pods). Hammer of Wrath attacks made by jump pack-equipped models with Chapter Tactics (Fire Hawks) also gain +1 Strength.

sharedRules.name: Speed and Fury
sharedRules.description: All Assault squads and Vanguard Veteran squads equipped with Warhawk Jump Packs with the Chapter Tactics (Fire Hawks) special rule, chosen as part of a Primary Detachment gain the Line unit Sub-Type.

sharedRules.name: The Livery of Curs
sharedRules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Fire Hawks) special rule lessens all cover saves they are receiving by 1. Eg. If a Fire Hawks Tactical Marine was in a ruin (5+ Cover Save) It would instead be a 6+ cover save.

sharedRules.name: Chapter Tactics (Howling Griffons)
sharedRules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Howling Griffons) Special Rule gains Into the Fray Special Rule.

sharedRules.name: Into the Fray
sharedRules.description: On the turn in which they make a successful charge, even if that charge is considered a Disordered Charge, models with the Howling Griffons special rule make their attacks at one initiative step higher than normal – after any initiative modifiers from other special rules have been taken into account.

sharedRules.name: Chapter Tactics (Novamarines)
sharedRules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Novamarines) Special Rule gains The Strength of Wisdom Special Rules.

sharedRules.name: The Strength of Wisdom
sharedRules.description: When rolling To Hit with this special rule as part of a Shooting Attack add+1 to the result of the roll if the enemy unit targeted by the attack has already been the target of another friendly unit composed entirely of the models with this special rule in the same shooting phase, and if the attacking model is within 6" of a model from that friendly unit. This does not affect attacks made with a Blast or Barrage special rules.

sharedRules.name: Chapter Tactics (Red Scorpions)
sharedRules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Red Scorpions) Special Rule gains Fortitude and Contempt Special Rules.

sharedRules.name: Fortitude and Contempt
sharedRules.description: Models with Chapter Tactics (Red Scorpions) may re-roll all failed Pinning tests but cannot benefit from the Evade Reaction.

sharedRules.name: Chapter Tactics (Sons of Medusa)
sharedRules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Sons of Medusa) Special Rule gains True Sons Special Rule.

sharedRules.name: True Sons
sharedRules.description: All shooting attacks made against a model with this special rule that does not have the Vehicle Unit Type, suffer a modifier of -1 to the strength of the attack.

sharedRules.name: Chapter Tactics (Star Phantoms)
sharedRules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Star Phantoms) Special Rule gains Orbital Wave Attack, Hail of Destruction and Unfettered Destruction Special Rules.

sharedRules.name: Orbital Wave Attack
sharedRules.description: Any unit in the detachment arriving via Deep Strike may re-roll any Reserve roll of 1 if its controlling player wishes.

sharedRules.name: Hail of Destruction
sharedRules.description:
Once per game, the player may declare the use of this ability and its effects last
from the start of the controlling player’s Shooting phase until the start of their next Shooting phase. During this period, all infantry and cavalry units in the detachment with Chapter Tactics (Star Phantoms) count their Rapid Fire, Assault and Heavy Weapons as being twin-linked.

sharedRules.name: Unfettered Destruction
sharedRules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Star Phantoms) Special rule receives +1 to hit attacking with any ‘Plasma’ or ‘Melta’ weapons.

rules.name: Strategic Comms
rules.description: Once per turn, when any friendly unit is called upon to take morale check or Pinning test, that Check may be made using the Leadership characteristic of the model with this special rule or any other model in the same unit as the model with this special rule. ln addition, as long as a model with this special rule is on the battlefield (but not in Reserves) then all Reserves rolls made by the controlling player may be re-rolled.

rules.name: Never Back Down
rules.description: If possible, a unit that includes a model with this special rule must issue a Challenge when Engaged in combat, and if an enemy player issues a Challenge to a unit including one or more models with this special rule then a model with this special rule must accept. In addition, during any Assault phase where this model begins the Fight sub-phase Engaged in a Challenge, or enters into a Challenge with an enemy model, this model and all friendly models in the same combat gain the Fearless special rule until the end of that Assault phase.

rules.name: Bolster Defenses
rules.description: Aer deployment, but before Scout redeployments and Infiltrate deployments, nominate one piece of terrain in your deployment zone (this cannot be one you have purchased as part of your army). The terrain piece’s cover save is increased by 1 for the duration of the game (to a maximum of 3+).

rules.name: Sacred Trust
rules.description: In missions where Victory points are scored for destroying units, if a Master of the Apothecarium is within 6" of a friendly Space Marine Infantry or Jump Infantry unit which is wiped out by the enemy, roll a D6. On a 5+, the player whose unit was destroyed also gains a Victory point, as well as the enemy.

rules.name: Master Sniper
rules.description: When making Shooting Attacks with any weapon that has the Sniper special rule, a model with this special rule adds the Rending (2+) and Shell Shock (1) special rules to the attack. If the weapon used already has the Rending (X) and Shell Shock (X) special rules, they do not stack with those provided by this special rule: use the highest of the two variants for the attack.

rules.name: Rally the Chapter
rules.description: Once per battle, at the start of any of the controlling player’s turns, this rule may be activated. Once activated take a Leadership test for this model: if passed then all friendly units that are Pinned or Falling Back and have at least one model that can draw line of sight to the model with this special rule immediately rally, and are no longer Pinned or Falling Back and may act normally this turn.

rules.name: Keeper of the Dead
rules.description: Keeper of the Dead: A Detachment that includes a model with this special rule may take an additional Castraferrum Dreadnought or Contemptor Dreadnought as part as the same Force Organisation choice as the model with this special rule. The model with this special rule must join the Dreadnought unit that has been selected at the beginning of the battle during deployment and may not voluntarily leave that unit during play - this is an exception to the Dreadnought Unit Type which would normally stop such models from joining a unit including a model with the Dreadnought Unit Type.

rules.name: Ancient Devotion
rules.description: While a model with this special rule is part of a unit, all Dreadnought models in that unit gain the It Will Not Die (5+) special rule.

rules.name: Master of the Relics
rules.description: A detachment that contains a model with this special rule may include an additional Relic of the Chapter. Eg a 1000 point army could contain two Relics of the Chapter.

rules.name: Slaughter-tallies
rules.description: Any enemy with the character sub-type that is slain in a Challenge within 6” of a Death-Speaker Chaplain gains The Executioners player an extra Victory Point.
